meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Ken Herrera Alex Liteplo Justin Sausville Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6207.

td.p: Ken Herrera, an MBA student originally from Denver, Colorado
Alex Liteplo, an educational publishing digital producer from Wakefield, Massachusetts
Justin Sausville, a urologist from Baltimore, Maryland (whose 3-day cash winnings total $76,800)

tr.td: EARLY MAN
TV TITLE ROLE PLAYING
AGING GRACEFULLY
STATELY RIVERS
WAYS TO LOSE MONEY
ONE VOWEL ONLY
(Alex: ...in each correct response.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'the missing link

Ken
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us a partial skull at the Smithsonian Hall of Human Origins.) Ouranopithecus macedoniensis, a 9-million-year-old ape from Greece, is a candidate as the long sought-for common ancestor of African apes & humans, popularly but inaccurately known by this two-word term')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us a partial skull at the Smithsonian Hall of Human Origins.) Ouranopithecus macedoniensis, a 9-million-year-old ape from Greece, is a candidate as the long sought-for common ancestor of African apes & humans, popularly but inaccurately known by this two-word term
